sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A mirrour to all that loue to follow the warres go trudge my little booke, possesse ech willing hand, and giue all leaue to looke, that seekes to vnderstand, the trauels of thy knight, plead hard to hold his right, who finds thee may be bould, his actions to vnfould. I. B.
[12] p. : ill.
Printed by Iohn Woolfe, London : 1589.
In verse. Signed at end: I.B. Signatures: A-B⁴ (last two leaves blank). "A poem on Peregrine Bertie, Baron Willoughby de Eresby"--STC (2nd ed.). Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
A mirrour to all that loue to follow the warres go trudge my little booke, possesse ech willing hand, and giue all leaue to looke, that seekes to vnderstand, the trauels of thy knight, plead hard to hold his right, who finds thee may be bould, his actions to vnfould. I. B.
[12] p. : ill.
Printed by Iohn Woolfe, London : 1589.
In verse. Signed at end: I.B. Signatures: A-B⁴ (last two leaves blank). "A poem on Peregrine Bertie, Baron Willoughby de Eresby"--STC (2nd ed.). Reproduction of original in the British Library.
